tasks.task: Administering inoculant to legume seeds while considering pesticide toxicity
subtasks: Conducting a survey on farmers' concerns about combining inoculant with seed-applied pesticides
Researching the effects of thioram and ppct on inoculant bacteria
Evaluating the impact of fungicides and insecticides on nodulation
Testing inoculant formulations (peat slurry, freeze-dried) and application timing
Assessing the influence of soil conditions (drought) on nodulation and end fixation
Recommending strategies to mitigate pesticide toxicity (double inoculant dose, immediate sowing, moist soil)
Leveraging prior legume cultivation for inoculant colonization

tasks.task: Field trial on legume inoculation and pesticide interactions
subtasks: Preparing experimental treatments (fungicide-coated peas, pea pickle tea, various inoculant formulations)
Conducting field trials in the Minapa region under dry conditions
Analyzing nodulation and end fixation results for different treatment combinations
Comparing seed-coating methods (fungicide, pickle tea) with inoculant application timing (24 hours vs. 1-2 hours before sowing)
Observing the effectiveness of peat vs. freeze-dried inoculant formulations
